Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ first sale live on Amazon India: All you need to know

The Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ smartphones come with the MediaTek Helio G36 processor, an HD+ display, and a 5,000mAh battery.

By
Marcia Sekhose
-
Published On: May 23, 2023 | Last Updated: May 23, 2023
Highlights
  • The first sale for the Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ is now live on Amazon.
  • These are the latest budget smartphones from Xiaomi in India.
  • Here’s a look at what the Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ offer and how you can buy them.

Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ first sale is now live on Amazon India. The Redmi A2 series offers the same set of specifications with minor differences. The two phones also run on Android 13 (Go edition) out of the box.

Show Full Article
Value for money
Redmi A2 (Classic Black, 2GB RAM, 32GB Storage) | Powerful Octa Core G36 Processor | Upto 7GB RAM | Large 16.5 cm HD+ Display with Massive 5000mAh Battery | 2 Years Warranty [Limited time Offer]
₹ 5699

₹ 7999
₹ 11999 (34% off)
Buy on Amazon

Redmi A2, Redmi A2+ sale, price

Redmi A2 is priced at Rs 6,299 for the base model with 2GB of RAM and 32GB of onboard storage. It also comes with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage and this one is priced at Rs 7,999. As for the Redmi A2+, this one is priced at Rs 8,499 and it comes with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage.

There’s a Rs 300 discount on select bank cards and no-cost EMI options that you can avail of on the Redmi A2 series. The two phones come in three colour options – Aqua Blue, Classic Black, and Sea Green. 

Redmi A2, Redmi A2+ specifications

Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ come with the same set of specifications but with two key differences. Let’s take a look at what the two budget phones have to offer:

  • Display: The Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ come with a 6.52-inch HD+ display that has a waterdrop notch on top.
  • Processor: Under the hood of the two phones run the MediaTek Helio G36 processor.
  • Cameras: The Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ sport an 8MP primary camera and a QVGA lens at the rear. You also get a 5MP front camera for selfies.
  • Battery, charging: The smartphones also pack the same 5,000mAh battery with 10W charging support. 
  • Connectivity: In terms of connectivity, the Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ come with a 3.5mm headphone jack, a micro-USB port, 4G VoLTE, and VoWiFi. 
  • Software: On the software front, the Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ run Android 13 (Go edition) out-of-the-box.
  • The first key difference between the two phones is that the Redmi A2+ has a rear fingerprint sensor and the Redmi A2 doesn’t. 
  • RAM and storage: This is another area where the two phones differ. The Redmi A2 comes in two variants of 2GB + 32GB and 4GB + 64GB. As for the Redmi A2+, it comes only with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage.

Xiaomi Pad 6, Pad 6 Pro with Snapdragon chipsets, up to 67W charging launched in China: price, specifications

Since the Redmi A2 and Redmi A2+ offer the same set of specifications it might get confusing which one to go for. But the Redmi A2+ seems like a better offering since the fingerprint sensor is an important feature. If that isn’t a concern then you can go for the lower-priced Redmi A2.
